title: 108_hr2894
content: The Act is titled as the "Theodore Roosevelt National Wildlife Refuge Act" and includes findings. The Congress finds that the Yazoo-Mississippi Delta in Mississippi is critical for the Louisiana Black Bear, various bird species, aquatic life, and river basin ecosystems. The bottomland hardwood forests have been cleared, and reforestation will benefit many species. The area serves as a migration corridor for birds from the Arctic Circle to South America. The Lower Delta in Mississippi offers recreational, research, and educational opportunities for various groups. It is an internationally significant environmental resource that requires active restoration and management to protect its value as a habitat for fish and wildlife. The region's natural, historical, and cultural assets, along with its environmental restoration potential, could contribute to the economic revitalization of the area. Additionally, the Lower Delta has the nation's highest potential carbon sequestration storage capacity. The establishment and purpose of the refuge in the Lower Delta in Mississippi is to protect its value as a habitat for fish and wildlife, contribute to economic revitalization, and utilize its high potential carbon sequestration storage capacity. The Secretary will establish the Theodore Roosevelt National Wildlife Refuge to preserve native Mississippi River ecosystems, provide habitat for migratory birds and the Louisiana Black Bear, maximize fisheries, and manage populations. The Theodore Roosevelt National Wildlife Refuge aims to preserve native ecosystems, provide habitat for wildlife, offer technical assistance to landowners, provide recreational opportunities, celebrate President Roosevelt, and increase resource education and business. The Secretary must publish a notice of the establishment of the Refuge in the Federal Register and local publications to achieve the purposes without violating section 6. The administration of the refuge is outlined in section 4. The Secretary administers lands, waters, and interests acquired under section 5 in accordance with the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966, the Refuge Recreation Act, and the purposes of the Refuge. A management plan must be issued within 18 months, including provisions for planning trails and access points. The Secretary shall provide public participation in developing the management plan, giving special consideration to local views. A Wildlife Interpretation and Education Center will be constructed within the Refuge. The Holt Collier Wildlife Interpretation and Education Center will be established within the Refuge to provide educational programs, promote environmental education, study wildlife, and honor Holt Collier, an African American hunting guide. SEC. 5. ACQUISITION OF LANDS, WATERS, AND INTERESTS THEREIN. The Secretary aims to acquire up to 25,000 acres of land, water, or interests within designated boundaries for the Refuge through donation, exchange, or purchase from willing sellers. Within 12 months of the Act's enactment, consultation will be done with State and local officials to determine appropriate boundaries for the Refuge. The Secretary aims to acquire land within designated boundaries for the Refuge through donation, exchange, or purchase. The selection area includes several counties in Mississippi. A detailed map of the Theodore Roosevelt National Wildlife Refuge will be prepared and made available for public inspection. The Secretary may make minor boundary revisions within the designated boundaries of the Refuge to achieve its purposes or facilitate property acquisition. SEC. 6. CONTINUED PUBLIC SERVICES. The Act does not prohibit commercial or recreational navigation on the Mississippi River or Yazoo River, construction activities for the Yazoo Backwater Pump Project, public port or recreational facility development, or railroad and highway construction within specified areas. SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS. The term "Refuge" refers to the Theodore Roosevelt National Wildlife Refuge, and "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior.
